title: Coffeemaker: Modeling Riemann sums part - b

content.description: Hot water is dripping through a coffeemaker, filling a large cup with coffee. The amount of coffee in the cup at time t, 0 ≤ t ≤ 6, is given by a differentiable function C, where t is measured in minutes. Selected values of C(t), measured in ounces, are given in the table above.
content.question: Is there a time t,2 ≤ t ≤4 , at which C'(t)=2? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: Is there a time t,2 ≤ t ≤4 , at which C'(t)=2? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 2.4: Connecting Differentiability and Continuity - Determining When Derivatives Do and Do Not Exist

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
